content: textured pumpkin crochet pattern by jessica barril ​​ materials yarn lion brand mandala in warlock or any dk weight yarn hook g 4 0mm fiberfill or preferred choice of stuffing stick or preferred choice of stem tapestry needle scissors gauge/finished dimensions gauge not important small 2 5 diameter 1 25 height not including stem medium 4 diameter 2 25 height not including stem large 4 5 diameter 3 height not including stem © 2018 jessica barril | page 1 of 5 abbreviations/stitches used single_crochet single_crochet half_double_crochet half_double_crochet double_crochet double_crochet fpdc front post double_crochet fpdc2tog front post double_crochet 2 together fphdc front post half_double_crochet fphdc2tog front post half_double_crochet 2 together notes/overview all pumpkins are crocheted in the round from the bottom up - rounds are continuous which means we begin the next round without slip stitching the last stitch and the first stitch together a stitch marker is recommended to keep track of the beginning of each round the bases for each size use different stitches for increasing and mainly that is because i was experimenting the small pumpkin base is crocheted with half_double_crochet stitch rounds the medium with single_crochet stitch rounds and the large pumpkin with alternating single_crochet/half_double_crochet stitch rounds you can use whichever method you prefer the only notable difference is the sturdiness of the bottom of the pumpkin the medium pumpkin has a bit more sturdiness in its base than the other two but that is pretty much it the body of the pumpkin is constructed using front post stitches and half_double_crochet/single_crochet stitches to form recessed lines the tops for each size also decrease slightly differently - the method used for the larger pumpkin results in a slightly deeper center the pumpkin is then shaped with a long tail by inserting the tapestry needle into the top center of the pumpkin through to the bottom center of the pumpkin multiple times making sure that the tail lines up the recessed stitches during each insert this way the tail is hidden behind the front post stitches and is not visible a taller pumpkin can be made by doing more repeats of round 6 small or round 9 medium/large and decreasing the top with fpdc2tog stitches as in the large pumpkin instructions pattern instructions for all pumpkin sizes single_crochet 8 into a magic_ring instructions for each size of pumpkin will now be separate for small the base is increased to 40 stitches before working the sides for medium/large the base is increased to 64 stitches © 2018 jessica barril | page 2 of 5 small pumpkin round 2 2hdc in each single_crochet 16 sts round 3 *half_double_crochet in next st 2hdc in next st* repeat between ** until end of round 24 sts round 4 *half_double_crochet in next 2 sts 2hdc in next st* repeat between ** until end of round 32 sts round 5 *double_crochet in next 3 sts 2dc in next st* repeat between ** until end of round 40 sts round 6 *fpdc around next 4 sts
